body.description: Thanks to a unique and powerful dishwashing technology, Finish All In 1 Powerball Dishwasher Detergent Tabs give you an amazing clean and Finish Jet-Dry shine every time - which means you will never have to re-wash your dishes again in your dishwasher.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful tablets that consistently deliver impressive results
reviews.reviewText: Finish's All in 1 Powerball Dishwashing Tablets set the bar high when it comes to kitchen cleaning solutions. These powerful tablets consistently deliver impressive results, easily earning their five-star rating.What stands out most about these tablets is their high performance. Each tab is a cleaning powerhouse that works effectively to remove even the toughest of food residues. From stubborn, dried-on food particles to greasy stains, these tablets take on a wide range of cleaning challenges, leaving dishes sparkling clean every time.Notably, the tablets do not leave any filmy residue on the dishes, a common issue with many other dishwasher detergents. This ensures that every glass, plate, and piece of silverware comes out of the dishwasher ready to use, without the need for any additional rinsing or cleaning. This level of clean is remarkable and sets these tablets apart from many competitors.The convenience of these tablets also deserves praise. Each tablet is individually packaged, making it easy to use just the right amount of detergent without any mess or waste. This ease of use, combined with the high cleaning power, makes dishwashing a more efficient and less tedious task.The fresh scent that these tablets leave is another positive aspect. It's not overpoweringly strong but leaves a subtle, clean smell that further enhances the sense of cleanliness. The pleasant aroma is a nice finishing touch to the overall dishwashing experience.In terms of quantity, the pack of 94 tablets is excellent value. It's enough to last for many dishwashing cycles, making it a cost-effective choice for regular use.In conclusion, Finish's All in 1 Powerball Dishwashing Tablets are an outstanding product that delivers exceptional results consistently. With their powerful cleaning properties, convenience, and fresh scent, they turn the chore of dishwashing into a hassle-free task. For their effective cleaning performance, no-residue finish, and excellent value, these dish tabs rightly earn a five-star rating. They are an indispensable addition to any kitchen cleaning routine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I've Been Using These for Years, They are Awesome!
reviews.reviewText: These are great dishwasher tabs, easier to use than liquid detergent and do a solid job. There's a reason these are so highly rated. Clean streak free & residue free dishes every time! I've been using these for years and will continue to use them.They are surprisingly powerful and can handle really dirty dishes. If you have something that is sticky or very greasy though I would recommend wiping that down before putting it in the dishwasher with a tab. While these are strong and the best detergent pods I have used, they are not perfect at getting absolutely everything. Highly recommend these, they have a nice light fresh smell also! Good quality product for a decent price, 94 tabs should last a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These are better for your dishwasher.
reviews.reviewText: These are indeed the foil wrapped pods (thank goodness). I've been using these for over 10 years since I bought my Kitchenaid dishwasher. They were recommended by the manufacturer at the time. They always get my dishes perfectly clean (I do pre-rinse them for good measure).They leave no film in the dishwasher. My dishwasher still looks brand new inside. No residue.When these foil wrapped pods were discontinued at all of the local stores, I tried the other "dissolving" pods, and within a few washes, I noticed a buildup in the dishwasher. Gross. After doing my own research, I determined that the outer casing (that's supposed to dissolve) essentially gets diluted into the water and redeposited on everything. Sometimes it doesn't all dissolve and leaves a film. You are eating it off your dishes!It's not good for the internal pumps and valves, and will lead to premature wear and plumbing problems of your appliance. This was confirmed by several repairmen and handymen (as well as my own common sense). One guy told me 1 out 4 calls is a pump failure (dishwashers and clothes washers) with either goo or partially dissolved pod shells jammed inside from the modern "dissolving" pods.My dishwasher and washing machine are still on their original pumps, and I'd like to keep it that way thank you.To open these pods, just tear the foil like a piece of paper. I find that simple, but it might be harder for those with dexterity problems. In this case, I recommend using gel liquid or powder with enzymes as the main ingredient (not bleach) instead of the dissolving pods.For those who complain that the foil pouches spill powder when opening, yes, that happens. Fairly often. Even if the pod comes out busted up, that doesn't matter! Powder is powder! It will still clean the dishes. Dump it in the detergent tray and move on with life. Back in the old days, dishwasher detergent was only sold as powder in a box. These foil wrapped pods are just compressed powder into a cube.For those who think it makes a mess when the powder spills on the floor, I learned that lesson 10 years ago. The simple "life hack" is to tear open the foil over the detergent tray. That way, if some spills when I open the foil, it will just go into the dishwasher where it belongs. Problem solved. Excess powder that misses the tray can contribute to the prewash. Another hidden benefit.Life seems to be a trade between convenience and longevity. Smart people find ways to get both. Not-so-smart people buy a new appliance every 3-5 years. Your choice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Terribly wrapped. Each puck is individually wrapped in foiled plastic that is nearly impossible to open neatly with wet hands. Besides the obvious waste of plastic, I am constantly removing tiny shreds of this silvery material from my dishwasher's filter.Now that my gripe is out of the way, these are fantastic. Cleans as well as other top brands at a much lower price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent product but breakage a problem!
reviews.reviewText: I have been using Finish tabs for years and really love how they work. I tried the "cellophone" wrapped tabs but not all of them disolved in my dishwasher. The tabs that I now buy are wrapped in thin foil which I tear to open. All great so far...however...too many times I find the tab broken and crumbled and unusable.This is a problem and I have written to the company about this. I hope they find a solution.Again...the actual product does the cleaning job excellently.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love it!! Gets my dishes clean…but it does leave a white film on my dishes tho. Other than that amazing!! I’m on my second box since I got my counter top dish washer last year for Christmas!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Red ball clean good!
Good for removing char off pans
reviews.reviewText: I use these to help scrub off char on my pans as long as the pan itself is not too oily. For fatty, oily or dishes with egg yolk, I go with Finish Quantum.These are cheap so I sometimes throw one of these into the washer for short wash cycle instead of the detergent compartment for half-load washes.
